article:
'Industrial waste' is the waste produced by industrial activity, such as that
of factories, mills and mines. It has existed since the outset of the
industrial revolution. http://www.epa.gov/osw/hazard/tsd/mercury/pdf/njac7-
26g1.pdf

Much industrial waste is neither hazardous nor toxic, such as waste fibre
produced by agriculture . [http://www.env.gov.bc.ca/epd/main/ema.htm
Environmental Protection ]

Penalties and fees are created as enforcement actions and to ensure that
violating conditions are corrected in a timely manner to ensure consistent
treatment of industrial dischargers; to eliminate economic advantages for
violations; and to ensure that states recover expenses attributable to violatio-
ns. [http://www.kingcounty.gov/operations/policies/rules/utilities/put8121p-
r.aspx King County Industrial Waste Enforcement Response Plan ]http://www.tceq.state.tx.us/nav/funding/fees.html
